description: From Middle English gentilmanly; equivalent to gentleman +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: gentlemanly (comparative more gentlemanly, superlative most gentlemanly)

entries.meaning: Of, being, pertaining to, or resembling a gentleman or gentlemen.
examples: Some schools bump up everyone’s grades, some just allow for more As and others all but eliminate the once-gentlemanly C.

adverbs.description: gentlemanly (comparative more gentlemanly, superlative most gentlemanly)

entries.meaning: In the manner or with the behavior of a gentleman; with social grace, politely.
